channel.title: Random Generator?
channel.description: Does anybody know a program that can have a list of items added to it then be randomly generate one item from that list?

item.title: Random Generator?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:8, topic:431595”]Since you are not on MSN and said that you would like me to write this for you. Here is a simple command-line java program that you can input (input any number here) strings and then get a random one back. This is far from the best method to do this, but I didn’t want to spend to much time. Trying to learn CPU’s in minecraft.

http://up.ht/zKr6OW[/quote]thanks babe

Read full topic

item.title: Random Generator?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Since you are not on MSN and said that you would like me to write this for you. Here is a simple command-line java program that you can input (input any number here) strings and then get a random one back. This is far from the best method to do this, but I didn’t want to spend to much time. Trying to learn CPU’s in minecraft.

item.title: Random Generator?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:6, topic:431595”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=534275.msg3906223#msg3906223 date=1328242641]

What do you mean?

Like you input a list of numbers and it randomly picks one of them?

Would be pretty easy to just instantiate an array and use Math.random()*array.length

or couldnt you just use random.org for a random thing?
[/quote]sad thing is…you gave the best answer lol. Appreciate the help guys[/quote]
Well I am the best programmer on this site!

I can does very good change ip in client!1

np :o

Read full topic

item.title: Random Generator?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Use a Java ArrayList to store the crap.
Use Java Collections to shuffle the set.
Pop the ArrayList.
